subject: Sales
title: When Trust Shatters
description: A quick win: understand When Trust Shatters.

hook.text: One broken promise destroys a deal that took six months to build. Trust is fragile.

buildup.text: Rebuilding trust costs ten times the effort of earning it in the first place.

discovery.text: After betrayal, buyers don't just distrust the person. They distrust the entire company.

twist.text: But admitting mistakes fast can actually boost trust. Vulnerability disarms anger.

climax.text: Great sellers never overpromise. They set honest expectations and then quietly exceed them.

punchline.text: Trust takes years to build and one lie to destroy.

quiz.question: What can paradoxically increase trust after a mistake?
